messages.message:
Hey team, I'm testing a 24.07 release vulnerability ticket and I was wondering how I could use crafting to test this. Whenever I have this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71331) branch checked out and run `cs <command>`, I get `Connection closed by remote host` and thus disconnected. I'm assuming 24.07 is missing the files that are present in master that configure these commands so I'm mostly wondering
• do I need anything more than the `.sandbox` folder (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/tree/master/.sandbox) off master on my PR branch to get the `cs` commands working?
• after that, is flipping the aihub env var flag all thats needed for getting enterprise up instead of aihub?

Hey @pauline.comising -- it depends:

1. If you want the 1-click experience we are used to now: this requires backporting a lot of fixes I made for running various services in local mode to 24.07. Probably not possible.
2. If you want to use Crafting as a Linux VM, and run `ppy` like the old days, then it's possible. It may be easier to use your laptop at that point though. It depends; the laptops are tricky to get working too :confused:
I would start with (2) by trying good old `ppy compile lite && ppy start lite` to see if it works in the crafting sandbox. If the services boot, you're in luck.
Oo gotcha, that makes sense, let me try the ppy compile stuff, but I think I'll concurrently kick off a cloud console sandbox in case things go sideways, thanks!
OK! Yep, that sounds like a good plan :)
